description.narrative: The Philippine Accelerator Lab will undertake externally facing interventions addressing priority development challenges, and internally facing experiments to embed new ways of doing development within the existing UNDP portfolio.

activity-description.narrative: The project team will be based in Manila, but will conduct nation-wide project/s.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
2019 indicators 1. Number of new models, approaches and insights from lab network documented and disseminating through working out loud 2. Number of frontier challenges identified and initiated
2020 revised indicators 1.1 Number of local solutions addressing key local challenges identified by the labs using new methods? 1.2 Number of experiments designed and undertaken by the ALab-PH? 2.1 Number of lead innovators (surfaced through solutions mapping) whose ideas that either a) get taken up by government or b) spin off into stand alone ventures or c) influence UNDP programming? 2.2 Number of solutions surfaced through collective intelligence methods that either a) get taken by government or b) spin off into standalone ventures or c) influence UNDP programming? 3.1 New models approaches, and insights from ALab-PH documented and disseminated through working out loud? 3.1.1 Social media engagement? 3.1.2 Short monthly blogs? 3.1.3 in-depth articles? 3.2 Methods for exploration, solutions mapping, collective intelligence, and experimentation developed, codified, and disseminated? 3.3 Number of regular engagements for exchange of knowledge with other country labs and within PH initiated? 3.3.1 In-country office? 3.3.2 With other country labs? 3.4 Extent to which that the Country Programme was supported through the frontier issues and solutions explored, mapped, and tested by the ALab-PH
2021 Revised indicators 1.1 Methods for exploration, solutions mapping, collective intelligence, and experimentation developed, codified, and disseminated 1.2 Number of activities conducted with Programme and Operations applying methods for exploration, solutions mapping, and experimentation to Country Programme (new) 1.3 Extent to which that the Country Programme was supported through the frontier issues and other challenges where solutions were explored, mapped, and tested with PH Alab 2.1 Number of local solutions addressing key local challenges identified by ALab PH using new method

1.1. 3​ local solutions addressing key local challenges identified by the labs using new methods​ 1.2. 3​ experiments designed and undertaken by the ALab-PH​ 2.1. 1​ lead innovator (surfaced through solutions mapping) whose ideas that either a) get taken up by government or b) spin off into stand alone ventures or c) influence UNDP programming​ 2.2. 1​ solution surfaced through collective intelligence methods that either a) get taken by government or b) spin off into standalone ventures or c) influence UNDP programming​ 3.1.1. significant​ social media engagement means ALAB creates 20 social media posts with a target reach of 5,000 engagements or more; non-existent means 0 social media posts and 0 social media engagement 3.1.2. 9​ Short monthly blogs​ posted 3.1.3. 2​ in-depth articles​ posted 3.2. 1 Method for exploration, solutions mapping, collective intelligence, and experimentation developed, codified, and disseminated​ 3.3.1. 3​ regular engagements for exchange of knowledge with PH initiated​ (CO) 3.3.2. 3​ regular engagements for exchange of knowledge with other country labs 3.4. significant means ALAB provides technical support to programme teams in 3 or more programmatic areas; non-existent means no technical support provided to any programmatic areas
2021 Revised Targets 1.1. 2 Methods for exploration, solutions mapping, collective intelligence, and experimentation developed, codified, and disseminated 1.2. 4 activities conducted with Programme and Operations applying methods for exploration, solutions mapping, and experimentation to Country Programme 1.3. Significant 2.1. 20 local solutions addressing key local challenges identified by ALab PH using new methods 2.2 3 experiments designed and undertaken by PH ALab 2.3 2 solutions and advocacies that either a) get taken up by government or b) spin off into standalone ventures or c) influence UNDP programming 3.1 6 Short Monthly Blogs or Other Pieces, 4 In-Depth Reports, 4 Contributions to Global / Regional Platforms & Ad Hoc Reports 3.2 3 engagements for exchange of knowledge with other country labs

1.1. 3​ local solutions addressing key local challenges identified by the labs using new methods​ 1.2. 3​ experiments designed and undertaken by the ALab-PH​ 2.1. 1​ lead innovator (surfaced through solutions mapping) whose ideas that either a) get taken up by government or b) spin off into stand alone ventures or c) influence UNDP programming​ 2.2. 1​ solution surfaced through collective intelligence methods that either a) get taken by government or b) spin off into standalone ventures or c) influence UNDP programming​ 3.1.1. significant​ social media engagement means ALAB creates 20 social media posts with a target reach of 5,000 engagements or more; non-existent means 0 social media posts and 0 social media engagement 3.1.2. 9​ Short monthly blogs​ posted 3.1.3. 2​ in-depth articles​ posted 3.2. 1 Method for exploration, solutions mapping, collective intelligence, and experimentation developed, codified, and disseminated​ 3.3.1. 3​ regular engagements for exchange of knowledge with PH initiated​ (CO) 3.3.2. 3​ regular engagements for exchange of knowledge with other country labs 3.4. significant means ALAB provides technical support to programme teams in 3 or more programmatic areas; non-existent means no technical support provided to any programmatic areas
2021 Revised Targets 1.1. 2 Methods for exploration, solutions mapping, collective intelligence, and experimentation developed, codified, and disseminated 1.2. 4 activities conducted with Programme and Operations applying methods for exploration, solutions mapping, and experimentation to Country Programme 1.3. Significant 2.1. 20 local solutions addressing key local challenges identified by ALab PH using new methods 2.2 3 experiments designed and undertaken by PH ALab 2.3 2 solutions and advocacies that either a) get taken up by government or b) spin off into standalone ventures or c) influence UNDP programming 3.1 6 Short Monthly Blogs or Other Pieces, 4 In-Depth Reports, 4 Contributions to Global / Regional Platforms & Ad Hoc Reports 3.2 3 engagements for exchange of knowledge with other country labs

1.1. 3​ local solutions addressing key local challenges identified by the labs using new methods​ 1.2. 3​ experiments designed and undertaken by the ALab-PH​ 2.1. 1​ lead innovator (surfaced through solutions mapping) whose ideas that either a) get taken up by government or b) spin off into stand alone ventures or c) influence UNDP programming​ 2.2. 1​ solution surfaced through collective intelligence methods that either a) get taken by government or b) spin off into standalone ventures or c) influence UNDP programming​ 3.1.1. significant​ social media engagement means ALAB creates 20 social media posts with a target reach of 5,000 engagements or more; non-existent means 0 social media posts and 0 social media engagement 3.1.2. 9​ Short monthly blogs​ posted 3.1.3. 2​ in-depth articles​ posted 3.2. 1 Method for exploration, solutions mapping, collective intelligence, and experimentation developed, codified, and disseminated​ 3.3.1. 3​ regular engagements for exchange of knowledge with PH initiated​ (CO) 3.3.2. 3​ regular engagements for exchange of knowledge with other country labs 3.4. significant means ALAB provides technical support to programme teams in 3 or more programmatic areas; non-existent means no technical support provided to any programmatic areas

1.1. 5 local solutions addressing key local challenges identified by the lab using new methods​ which are the establishment of the ZEP local convergence, advocacy on use of SalikLakbay, promotion of circular economy and digital finance to next generations cities, use of chatbots for data innovation and innovation in the supply chain through EMPOWERPH 1.2. 5 experiments designed and undertaken by the ALab-PH​ which were on digital finance (ADEPT - FMML and cash disbursement), marine litter (multi-stakeholder consultation - NPOA), use of chatbots for data collection in surveys, use of satellite imagery for poverty estimation and machine-estimated data on multidimensional poverty and establishment of Pintig Lab for data innovation and analysis. 2.1. 1​ lead innovator which is Department of Science and Technology (DOST) wherein their adoption of SalikLakbay was institutionalized in their organization 2.2. 4 solution surfaced through collective intelligence. These were EmpowerPH on supply chain (connects suppliers to beneficiaries), ADEPT for digital financing, MSME chatbot survey, ZEP chatbot survey (promoting local convergence 3.1.1. Significant​ – ALab-PH was able to share 32 unique posts under UNDP CO platforms. In Facebook, ALab-PH posts had 96,804 reach, 110,158 impressions, and 7,035 engagements 3.1.2. 4 blogs posted 3.1.3. 2​ in-depth articles published/posted 3.2. 1 method of solutions mapping developed, codified, and disseminated​ which is the SalikLakbay field guide 3.3.1. 44 meetings/workshops attended within the CO 3.3.2. 16​ meetings/workshops attended and participated with other country labs 3.4. Significant - ALab-PH was able to provide technical support to programme teams in facilitating achievement of results particularly in the areas of data innovation, digital cash transfers, inclusive innovation policy research, marine litter and next generation governance.
